text:
{"fixed_xml":"<ITEM>
  <HEAD>5. Bey Herrn Daniel Eckenstein dem Buchdrucker in der Eschemer-Vorstatt sind folgende Bücher zu haben:</HEAD>
  <BIBL>
    <AUTHOR>Dr. Johann Rambach</AUTHOR>
    <TITLE>Erbauliches Hand-Büchlein für Kinder</TITLE>
    <FORMAT>8vo</FORMAT>
  </BIBL>
  <BIBL>
    <AUTHOR>Johann Arndt</AUTHOR>
    <TITLE>Sechs geistreiche Bücher vom wahren Christenthum</TITLE>
  </BIBL>
  <BIBL>
    <AUTHOR>deßelben</AUTHOR>
    <TITLE>Geistreiches Paradiß-Gärtlein</TITLE>
    <FORMAT>8vo</FORMAT>
  </BIBL>
  <BIBL>
    <AUTHOR>Johann-Hübner</AUTHOR>
    <TITLE>Zweymahl zwey und fünffzig auserlesene biblische Historien aus dem Alten und Neuen Testament</TITLE>
    <FORMAT>8vo</FORMAT>
  </BIBL>
  <BIBL>
    <TITLE>Der Gnaden-Schlüssel aller Kinderen GOttes</TITLE>
    <FORMAT>12mo</FORMAT>
  </BIBL>
  <BIBL>
    <TITLE>Die Weege und Wercke GOttes in der Seele</TITLE>
    <FORMAT>12mo</FORMAT>
  </BIBL>
  <BIBL>
    <TITLE>Übungen sich stets in der Gegenwart GOttes zu halten</TITLE>
    <FORMAT>8vo</FORMAT>
  </BIBL>
</ITEM>","number_of_corrections":17,"explanation":"- Replaced OCR artefacts (√, ≤, §) with correct characters and diacritics: Bücher (2×), Büchlein, für, Paradiß, Gärtlein, Hübner, fünffzig, Schlüssel, Übungen (10 fixes).
- Normalized all format strings to “8vo” and removed stray ‘in ’ outside elements by placing the format cleanly inside <FORMAT> (4 fixes).
- Promoted the opening prose (“5. Bey Herrn … zu haben:”) into a dedicated <HEAD> element to keep <ITEM> cleanly structured (1 fix).
- Split the Arndt entry at “Item …” into two <BIBL> records, using <AUTHOR>deßelben</AUTHOR> for the second, and removed stray punctuation/“Item” between records (2 fixes total structural cleanup)."}

- Split the Arndt entry at “Item …” into two <BIBL> records, using <AUTHOR>deßelben</AUTHOR> for the second, and removed stray punctuation/“Item” between records (2 fixes total structural cleanup).
